byline.original: By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Dr K Clodius reptd to have indicated Germany's dissatisfaction with Yugoslav attitude, conf with Min Cincar-Markovitch; Yugoslav police uncover secret firearms stores in German-operated factory; Rumania seizes 60 foreigners; Bulgarian Min Popoff stresses friendship with neighbors
snippet: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 30--Dr. Karl Clodius, German trade expert, came here today on one of his mysterious trips around the Balkans and conferred with Alexander Cincar-Markovitch, the Foreign Minister, after first reporting to Commerce Minist...

headline.main: NAZIS BEGIN TALKS ON YUGOSLAV PACT; Trade Parley Information Is Sought by Economic Expert on Visit to Belgrade HIDDEN ARMS ARE FOUND Weapons in Plant Managed by German--Rumania Seizes 'Tourists' in Oil Field

lead_paragraph: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 30--Dr. Karl Clodius, German trade expert, came here today on one of his mysterious trips around the Balkans and conferred with Alexander Cincar-Markovitch, the Foreign Minister, after first reporting to Commerce Minister Ivan Andres and to Milivoje Pilja, economic secretary ...
